entry.title: Creating a website using pelican and github pages
entry.summary: In short, this is how this sucker was created by me.
entry.content:
Github Pages.

  1. create a new repository names username.github.io and that's already basically it

â€¦or create a new repository on the command line

echo "# henningschmies.github.io" >> README.md git init git add README.md git commit -m "first commit" git remote add origin https://github.com/HenningSchmies/henningschmies.github.io.git git push -u origin master

Run on server

  • Switch to the output directory.
  • Run python -m pelican.server.
  • Visit localhost:8000 in your browser to preview the blog.

You should be able to browse a listing of all the posts in your blog, along with the specific post you created.

A good guide on how to set up sites with pelican is from dataquest https://www.dataquest.io/blog/how-to-setup-a-data-science-blog/
